title: YouTube Cracks Down on EVM, VVPAT Videos: Monetization Curbs Spark Controversy
content:
YouTube has taken action against creators discussing the efficacy of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) and Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) in India, just before the Lok Sabha elections. 

The platform has placed monetization curbs on videos by creators Mehgnad and independent journalist Sohit Mishra, citing its policy against demonstrably false information.  While Mishra's channel has over 3.68 lakh subscribers, Meghnad's boasts over 42,000. 

This comes months after YouTube announced measures to combat disinformation around EVMs in Indian elections.  The platform has been criticized for its handling of sensitive content, raising questions about censorship and freedom of expression.
author: Scroll Staff
